metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26769 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability found in Liblouis Lou_Trace v.3.24.0 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via the resolveSubtable function at compileTranslationTabel.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26769` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblouis-bin - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
liblouis-data - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
liblouis14 - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
python-louis - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
python3-louis - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: liblouis package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5').
